resources.string: Jeopardy Android uses the jService API created by @sottenad. The content is pulled from the fan-created Jeopardy game J! Archive. Jeopardy Android is for educational purposes only and has no affiliation with Jeopardy Productions.

1. From the menu, select Play. A clue will display in the blue box with the category at the top and the question in the body of the text.

 2. Enter your answer in the text field. Some hints: You don't need to enter leading articles like a, an, or the. These are automatically removed. Names, spellings and punctuations must match exactly. For names, you'll most likely need a first name and a last name.

 3. Press Submit. If you're wrong, you can try again. If you're right, you'll see the next clue.

 4. Each clue has a dollar value just like the original Jeopardy. If you're right, your points go up. If you're wrong, you lose points. You can find your session and lifetime score on the States page.

 5. Don't know the answer? Press Skip. You'll see the next clue.

 6. Give up? You can always press the Show Answer button.
